mmj.tmff

Class TMFFUnformatted

  • java.lang.Object
    • mmj.tmff.TMFFMethod
      • mmj.tmff.TMFFUnformatted

  • public class TMFFUnformatted
extends TMFFMethod
    TMFFUnformatted overrides basic the TMFFMethod renderFormula method to provide the old, unformatted output used previously in mmj2.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TMFFUnformatted

        public TMFFUnformatted()
        Standard constructor for TMFFUnformatted.

        Sets maxDepth to Integer.MAX_VALUE so that no depth breaks are triggered.

    • Method Detail

      • renderFormula

        public int renderFormula(TMFFStateParams tmffSP,
                         ParseTree parseTree,
                         Formula formula)
        Outputs a formula and outputs it to a StringBuilder without doing the special TMFF formatting.

        This method overrides the TMFFMethod renderFormula() method! It provides a fallback for cases when the TMFF algorithm fails (e.g. excessive indentation for line length.)

        Overrides:
        renderFormula in class TMFFMethod
        Parameters:
        tmffSP - TMFFStateParams initialized, ready for use.
        parseTree - ParseTree for the formula to be formatted. NOT USED in this override method!
        formula - formula to be formatted.
        Returns:
        number of lines rendered or -1 if an error was encountered and the formula could not be formatted.

      • renderSubExprWithBreaks

        protected int renderSubExprWithBreaks(TMFFStateParams tmffSP,
                                      ParseNode currNode,
                                      int leftmostColNbr)
        Specified by:
        renderSubExprWithBreaks in class TMFFMethod

      • updateMaxDepth

        public boolean updateMaxDepth(int maxDepth)
        Updates maxDepth for a TMFFMethod if the Method allows updates.

        As of the initial release, only TMFFAlignColumn uses maxDepth. The methods TMFFFlat and TMFFUnformatted have maxDepth = Integer.MAX_VALUE which results in no maxDepth line breaks from happening -- therefore, they do not allow updates after initial construction of the method.

        Specified by:
        updateMaxDepth in class TMFFMethod
        Parameters:
        maxDepth - parameter.
        Returns:
        boolean - true only if update performed.
